Reviews.Title: Good netbook, no driver problems.
Reviews.Author: Gregory Palermo
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews about this netbook.  I paid particular attention to those with driver problems.  I decided it was good value and that I'd take the risk of dealing with any potential driver problems.  After receiving the netbook and doing the initial sign-on and setup, the first thing that I then did was start the HP Support Assistant, selected 'Updates & tune-ups' and applied all updates before proceeding.  Only then did I apply all the windows updates via the normal windows updates. All updates went on fine without any problems.  It was only then that I proceeded to install any other software.  I've had no driver problems or network issues what-so-ever.  All my favorite programs work just fine.  This is a nice little netbook and I'd recommend it.  The only issues I had any trouble with was setting up the T-Mobile access.  I was unable to register online because the online registration process requires a phone number associated with the SIM card.  This was fixed by calling T-Mobile and getting a phone number assigned to the SIM.  The only other problem was then setting up an online account with T-Mobile.  To setup this account requires that a temporary password be sent, via a text message, to the SIM.  This process assumes that you're setting up a phone, not a netbook or PC.  There was no way to receive this message on the netbook.  According to T-Mobile support the only way to get this password was via this text message.  They recommended that I remove the SIM and put it in an unlocked phone or take it down to a local T-Mobile store have them do that for me.  Fortunately, I had an older unlocked phone that accepted the SIM and I was able to text the password that way.  Other than that everything setup just fine.  The performance is good for such a little machine.  I purchased this mostly for when I travel.  Now I'm retired so I only travel for pleasure not business.  While actually traveling I mostly use it as an entertainment device, mostly playing games and watching videos.  However, I also use it for other functions, like tracking my finances via Quicken, which it also performs very well.  Battery life is good, not great, but more than adequate.  This netbook performs very well in this capacity.  So don't believe all those negative reviews concerning the drivers.  You just need to make sure you update everything first, starting with the HP drivers via the Support Assistant.

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop, buggy drivers
Reviews.Author: Noble
Reviews.Content: I was just about ready to send this one back, but decided to give it one more shot with HP tech support.  I normally shun tech support these days because of the severe offshore-ness that has infested support centers these days. However, I liked the cellular broadband capabilities of this unit and nothing else on the current market fits my requirements as this one does.  The fellow in India I got connected with turned out to be an extremely knowledgeable chap with fine language skills.  What it appears is that HP sent these little buggers out with terribly immature drivers for the cellular broadband networking and the support software loaded on this machine was also seriously deficient. It took the better part of an hour to get these items corrected, but the end result is a laptop that now functions as it should and fits the bill for me superbly.  Also, Windows 8 is easily tamed to look and function nearly identical to Windows 7, so don't let all the bad press and whining deter you.  I recall the same loud noises when Windows 7 was sent to replace XP.

Reviews.Title: windows 8, 4G, & upgrades
Reviews.Author: Marc Salazar
Reviews.Content: I bought this computer being iffy about windows 8. But I am glad I made this choice. windows 8 on this computer works flawlessly, I had zero problems with the OS or hardware. Windows 8 works great with net books mainly because it uses less resources. the app use for a netbook is a great feature from netflix to simple banking. the 4G in my is opinion great but I broke the sim card so that didnt last very long.(SIM card is located in the battery compartment).ok now to the matter of important upgrades. I will tell you off the bat windows 8 has a 10 sec start up with a standard  hard drive. i upgraded my hp netbook to full specs:Crucial m4 128GB 2.5-Inch Solid State Drive SATA 6Gb/s with Data Transfer Kit CT128M4SSD2CCA  this will increase  battery life and will produce less heat making your netbook last longer.and i upgraded the ram as well: Corsair Vengeance 8GB (2x4GB)  DDR3 1600 MHz (PC3 12800) Laptop  Memory (CMSX8GX3M2A1600C9) a little expensive yes but well worth it.Intructions on how to upgrade parts. a little youtube wont hurt but here i go.first to access the ram, wifi, bluetooth, hard drive. you have to remove the battery using the battery release lever. then use the same slide lever but slide it al the way to the other side and push/slide the bottom plate off.ok here is where things went down hill. the data tranfer kit that came with the ssd i bought doesnt work. well the sata to usb works but not the software. this took me a while to figure out, but in the end i found a trial software that works with windows 8 since this windows uses GPT uefi bootup, other windows use the MBR(master boot record.get the compatible software here:  www  farstone  com/software/drive-clone.php this is the only softwhere i found that can transfer data and make the ssd bootable with win 8.and enjoy this computer with the upgrades i have listed. with the upgrades windows loads in less than 3 seconds and shutdowns in 5. apps load up way more faster than a standard hard drive.The wieght and feel of this netbook arent that bad, netbook has a rubber type of covering on bottom and top so it scratches less and you can carry with bare hands in confidence with its rubbery gripe body.All parts and accesories I purchased for this netbook:Crucial m4 128GB 2.5-Inch Solid State Drive SATA 6Gb/s with Data Transfer Kit CT128M4SSD2CCA ssdCorsair Vengeance 8GB (2x4GB)  DDR3 1600 MHz (PC3 12800) Laptop  Memory (CMSX8GX3M2A1600C9) ramBUFFALO 8x USB 2.0 Portable DVD Writer - DVSM-PC58U2VB  external dvd/cd/rw/rrooCASE Neoprene Netbook Sleeve Case Cover for Acer Aspire One AO522-BZ897 10.1-Inch HD Netbook Diamond Black (Invisible Zipper Triple-Pocket - Black)  sleeveMicrosoft Arc Touch Mouse - Year of the Dragon I had to pick this one because all the mouses i had did not work with windows 8.enjoy this netbok it is worth it.EDIT: since amazon likes blocking external site urls i modified it to help the people!

Reviews.Title: HP
Reviews.Author: JRN "JRN"
Reviews.Content: I've had the product for a week. It does need to be customized and is taking some time to get use to (due to windows 8) but i don't have any complaints. As far as price it was cheaper, quicker and easier then when i tried to order it directly from HP. two thumbs up for amazon. I haven't tried to set up the tmobile wifi get. Also it automatically added the other devices (printer, laptops, xbox) on mynetwork which was great for me, but if you don't want to share these locations there's ways of blocking it. Also it came loaded with ALOT of  Microsoft windows programs that are similar to the gmail ones i use so i had to delete them (video chat, calendar, email etc.) as they were set to default and want to sync and i'm happy with my gmail products.

Reviews.Title: pint-sized power
Reviews.Author: Andrew Tolonen
Reviews.Content: I am using the HP Dm1-4310nr as my primary machine and am very pleased with its performance. It boots up quickly, runs all my software efficiently, and has a plethora of ports for connecting externals. Thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: Workhorse Netbook
Reviews.Author: ATypical Consumer
Reviews.Content: This is a great notebook! I followed the recommendations of a previous reviewer to upgrade the hard drive with a Crucial M4. The netbook is now a serious productivity machine. It boots up quickly in just a few seconds, and the battery lasts a long time. The T-Mobile data plan of 200MB a month is a bonus (it was confusing, as one reviewer described, because it looks like the free Internet access is only for 30 days, but it renews each month). It came with a single 4GB memory stick in one slot, leaving the other empty. I did upgrade the RAM to 8GB, but the CPU is a bit slow for any applications that would be that memory intensive, so the 4GB it comes with should be enough. There are other ultraportables with nicer-looking cases, but they can't touch this one's price, upgradeability, and battery life.

Reviews.Title: Everything I expected!
Reviews.Author: Scott Miller
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews on laptops and decided this was perfect for my home use. I didn't want to be carrying around one of the bigger laptops. I have had it for a month now and start up is quick and the battery life is great. This is the first laptop I have owned and I have not had a problem. I would purchase another one if needed. I would recommend this to a friend.

Reviews.Title: Sweet little computer
Reviews.Author: jerold pick
Reviews.Content: just bought dm1 on the basis of Greg's review.Update: 3 days later, did what Greg suggested, there were 38 windows updates and 0 hp changes. thanks for the tip. The Wi-fi and LTE(4G) took 5-10 minutes to connect! Very Satisfied with this lightweight, easy to use computer. 5***** Look for a $399 price tag.

Reviews.Title: UPDATED:  5/2/2013  NICE COMPUTER BUT ......
Reviews.Author: Bob_IN_FL
Reviews.Content: UPDATE:  4/2/13  4PMGot this from HP today.  Look at FAQ  number 3.  Does this mean that T-Mobile automatically sets account to 200mb every 30 days for 24 months?  IF YES, then I'll change from 1 star to 5 stars!!UPDATE 5/1/2013ON MAY 1, Account was back to 200mb.  Changed rating to 5 stars.  However, the only way knowledge of this was achieved was through other purchasers.  No where did T-mobile know about this "offer" at their retail outlets or 800, 888 Customer service.[...]I like this computer and have no issues with Amazon.  According to the product description,"Includes 200MB/month of free T-Mobile 4G broadband for 2 years"After following directions and registering SIM card, got only 30 days of total service, not 2 years  in my account.  T-Mobile on the phone and in person said there is no such plan and after 30 days of service, customer must pay for any 3G/4G service at published rates.At time of this review, HP and Amazon very helpful tracking this issue down before I return the computer.

Reviews.Title: Powerhouse in a little package
Reviews.Author: Jose J. Garcia "JJ From Texas"
Reviews.Content: I've owned my DM1 for 2 years now. I have Dreamweaver CS6, Visual Studio 2012 Pro, Adobe Photoshop CS6, MS Office 2010 with Access and Visio, and a suite of other packages loaded onto it. It has been trouble-free since the day I bought it. The battery holds up very well as this little guy uses very little power with the smaller screen. No screen clarity issues. The processor isn't a rocket, but it is sufficient to do the job. I did add another 4g of memory which made a huge difference. I've not had this much luck with a laptop, and especially not in this price range. Get 'em before HP discontinues them as HP is notorious for discontinuing a good product that's offered in this price range. I recommended this laptop to a co-worker, and she is having a similar positive experience with hers. I take mine everywhere. Durable case, and still very serviceable. Easy access to internals. Definitely a bargain!

Reviews.Title: Price and Quality
Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: FIrst off this isn't a gaming laptop.  I bought this for packing around on campus and everywhere else.  I've had this pc for nearly a month now and have to say I love it.  This is nearly a 3rd of the price of a mac air and better made than the Viao.  The onboard graphics chip doesn't let me down either.  Through the HDMI port I get full sound and picture quality on my 32" flat screen.  And running both screens, web browser streaming anything , running code in eclipse, typing a paper in office and all my cloud accounts syncing this thing keeps going.  I did upgrade the ram (Corsair Vengeance 8GB (2x4GB) DDR3 1600 MHz (PC3 12800) Laptop Memory) and the hard drive.  The bottom-line is the processor, its great but not for gaming.  This computer stays nice and cool while multi-tasking.  If your savvy installing a different OS isn't that trifling and hp provides most of the drivers.This is a good bet!

Reviews.Title: Advice for people who are having driver problems
Reviews.Author: Naif
Reviews.Content: I purchased this laptop and immediately switched its hard drive for an SSD. When I installed windows 8 on it, I had problems with a few drivers. They cause your laptop to not load your OS. You would have to do startup repair and "refresh" your PC. However, I found out that you can install the graphics driver without any problems. Another driver you might want is the Wi-fi card driver, but it will cause your computer to have startup problems. A work around is to connect to the Internet using the included T-mobile SIM card or using an Ethernet cable. After you're connected, go to Device Manager and you'll find an exclamation mark next to your network driver. Right click on it and choose "update driver." And then let it search automatically online and it'll find the driver and install it. That way, you'll get the two most important drivers: the graphics driver and wifi card. Until HP fixes the other drivers, these two should allow you to operate your computer smoothly.

Reviews.Title: HP Pavilion DM1-4310nr 11.6" Laptop (T-Mobile 4G)
Reviews.Author: E. Arenz
Reviews.Content: Got this for my brother.  He loves it as it allows him to use the internet at his cabin.  Ergonomics are good, display is sharp.  It took a bit of tech support to get the 2 years of included T-Mobile service to be recognized (validated) and up and running.  100% improvement over his Intel Atom based laptop (which he promptly gave away)...

Reviews.Title: Awesome!!
Reviews.Author: Kenneth M Karsh
Reviews.Content: Awesome little computer !!! It's as powerful for my needs as a larger laptop. Well done. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: HP Pavillion DM1 - TMo
Reviews.Author: Kevin J
Reviews.Content: Was looking for a compact laptop to be used on the road by one of our service techs.This HP looked to fulfill all our needs especially as it has built in connectivity to access our cloud docs etc.Arrived from Amazon in quick time and on un-boxing very pleased with feel and finish.Following a previous review I loaded all HP updates and then the windows updates (which took a couple of tries).All appeared well as I left the machine to update overnight; in the morning the machine was updated fine but the battery was at 0%Googled fixes (seems to be quite a common fault) tried most of them and then resorted to HP who ran through most of what I did (battery in/out, power button drain, BIOS updates) all to no avail.HP sent a box for free repair so that is where it is right now; if I get the machine back and it works I will be happy to leave 5 stars for it!As a side note the TMo SIM activated fine, just followed instructions (must have wireless off during activation), it did give a message that the 'free' service was for a month not the 2 years as promised.UPDATE - First the good news; received the laptop back in quick time, had a new battery and BIOS module and working great, the bad news was that service dept removed SIM card and did not send it back, did have a service number to call but they confirmed they lost it. HP (Asia) not very helpful, they kept saying TMo card was Amazon no problem. In the end I called TMo and for $1.07 they sent a new SIM that activated fine and also came qith 24 months of 200MB for free so finally I have a 5 Star machine!Works great on the road; just need a power adapter as the charger does not fit the 110v truck outlet

Reviews.Title: great laptop
Reviews.Author: Devon white
Reviews.Content: i bought at this laptop at target it went on clerance to 181.79. never opened brand new i actually bought two of them. its very fast great sound it has beats built in speakers, its not big and bulky good ram good memory

Reviews.Title: GREAT Computer for the price
Reviews.Author: ATRacing
Reviews.Content: Really nice, great little keyboard, very comfortable, perfect size.I havent tried to deal with T-Mobile yet... but otherwise great.Only complaint so far is that keyboard is not backlit.

Reviews.Title: Small, but powerful laptop
Reviews.Author: Jangail719 "Scrabble player"
Reviews.Content: Fast, light weight and easy to use.  I've used it for a month and after I got used to Windows 8, which was new for me, I am really enjoying this little machine.  Battery is good so I'm not restricted to plugging in this laptop frequently.

Reviews.Title: Sloooooow
Reviews.Author: Gio
Reviews.Content: It's difficult to tell whether it's the machine or Windows 8 but with 4GB and nothing else running should Solitaire hesitate?  In addition, there's no evidence of the T-Mobile Broadband despite HP's setup instructions directing you how to access it.  All-in-all, a very disappointing purchase.Followed Scott B.'s request to contact HP Customer Support I reported the following issues:1. No evidence of T-Mobile Broadband2. The "B" and right-hand Shift Key stops working requiring reboot3. Apps change when moving cursor4. When opening a new tab on windows the screen goes blank rather than showing eight most recent URLs5. The MS function keys (F8 Extend or F4 Repeat last command) don't work, instead bringing up Windows options6. The machine is generally slowThe very courteous gentleman in Manila first denied responsibility saying these were all 'software issues'.  When I persisted that at least the T-Mobile feature was HP's he said it was the seller's responsibility and finally suggested I call QVC Premium Support which I, of course, did.  After waiting for seven and a half minutes QVC informed me that HP sends lots of people their way but they don't have a clue why.Is there another company as screwed up as HP?Added: 14-Oct:  I've had enough!  I sent the machine to HP at their request and, after ten days, received it back and ABSOLUTELY NOTHING had been done.  All of the issues cited above remain.  Over the months, I've spoken to 19 HP people who routed me around amongst themselves, none willing to admit responsibility for the T Mobile offer.  I finally contacted the seller who "called HP and t-mobile about this problem. HP can do nothing about it, which makes me very disappointed." so now I'm arranging to return it to him.I will never buy another HP computer.  The company deserves to go out of business.

Reviews.Title: SO ANNOYING!!!
Reviews.Author: Natural Remedy Lover
Reviews.Content: I took off a star because I am SO ANNOYED with the "2 year free T-Mobile" internet program that comes with this computer. This is a very AGGRESSIVE program. Tonight, it started taking over my computer and it kept taking me to their site whenever I tried to go to a site that I WANTED TO GO TO!! Afterall, this is MY COMPUTER! It messed up my computer, and I got so angry I deleted the freaking program!!! The computer is fine, but the T-Mobile program SUCKS!!!

Reviews.Title: Not ready for prime time...
Reviews.Author: jeff3663
Reviews.Content: I needed a small netbook with decent specs to replace my aging Toshiba 13".  This unit seemed to offer the best bang for the buck -- at least on paper.  Built in 4g was a huge selling point.  I like this size, weight, screen and battery life, etc. -- especially for the price. However, problems started as soon as I tried to do Windows 8 updates.  The system froze after what seemed like hours.  Called tech support and rep was very helpful, but Windows 8 and this machine too new and he was working in uncharted waters.  Note -- was told the midwest tech support office was closing soon and it was being moved offshore -- not a good sign.  System had to be completely refreshed and a large Windows update had to be hidden.  After that the rest of the updates loaded.  Since then more Windows 8 updates released and I tried to upload -- only the small ones worked.  Got message advising of update failure.  There are now 3 large excluded updates that can't be loaded.I feel I am left with little choice but to return this machine. I think this system in Windows 7 would be a better fit.  Windows 8 not ready for prime time -- at least on this machine and Windows 8 in general seems like a solution in search of a problem.

Reviews.Title: Dont't Buy this Notebook if You plan to use it outside T-MOBILE coverage area !! The Modem is LOCK  !!!
Reviews.Author: Sergio
Reviews.Content: I buy my DM1 4130nr (with T-MOBILE SIM Card included) from Amazon.com but now I'm in Italy without any T-MOBILE coverage. So , I try with a local carrie SIM but, this a very terrible surprise, the device take a signal from broadband carrier but is LOCKED !!! I've already chat with T-MOBILE support and they told me to ask to Hp Support.Anda Last but Least Itoday I discovery that may warranty perdiod is Expired in October 2013 !!So my question is: How i can unlock my device , sold by HP ??Best Regards.

Reviews.Title: This is a great little laptop I bring it with me to my customers to show pic.
Reviews.Author: James S Notaro Sr
Reviews.Content: I love this laptop, it's light fast, and clear. I bring it to customers to show pics. from other jobs, and I run my accounting package on it, it's a little slow starting up, but after that it runs very smooth.

Reviews.Title: It's legit
Reviews.Author: Kayla Ann Pete
Reviews.Content: Beats Audio makes the music even better. I can jam to it really loud and it still sounds fantastic. ;)

Reviews.Title: a perfect netbook
Reviews.Author: leonidas sfyris
Reviews.Content: Using it for about 3 months and loving it. Very fast on win 8.1 , beautiful screen and great battery (4 hours least). With an ssd and 4 gb more ram the computer is silent and lasts longer.Using also bazos tweaker to set cpu profiles helps manage the battery better.

Reviews.Title: Great pc of equipment
Reviews.Author: David Silverman
Reviews.Content: Wonderful pc of equipment, especially when you are out and there is no Wifi around. Windows 8 really shines and the battery life is great.

Reviews.Title: Great system
Reviews.Author: karen
Reviews.Content: I like that is small enough to carry around in my backpack, I use this system is for my homework and it works great for that.

Reviews.Title: Good Performance/Light weight
Reviews.Author: teej1010
Reviews.Content: I was looking for something to replace an older 'large' laptop that I use primarily when traveling.  After much debate I dismissed the tablets because they really didn't have all of the functionality I require.  I chose the DM1-4310nr because of its weight, size, price and the HP reputation (I've owned many HP products).With the exception of Windows 8, which I'm still trying to adapt to, this laptop has performed better than any laptop previously owned.  I am very pleased with its rapid wireless connection and the way it zips through files, especially large photos.  The one thing that has been a challenge is the lack of disk drive.  This has caused work arounds to install software I own that is on disks.

Reviews.Title: Have a Lot of Problems with "Free" Mobile Broadband
Reviews.Author: biinouye
Reviews.Content: After setting this up, T-Mobile says I only have a 30 day free trial, not 2 years of service.  Tried calling HP for support and they were unwilling or unable to help.  Don't every buy an HP product if you expect to get their "award-winning"  service because you won't get any.  Will be returning this product if the seller does not resolve this matter.

Reviews.Title: Buyer beware - bad hinge design and HP does not honor international warranty
Reviews.Author: srvsan
Reviews.Content: Purchased a previous iteration of the product in Singapore less then a year ago and the left hinge has cracked on the inside causing the LCD screen casing to unhinge from the rest of the unit. The unit was in-warranty and multiple calls to HP support in the U.S. led to nowhere and culminated in HP refusing to provide any remediation other than my having to ship the unit to HP,Singapore. This unit supposedly comes with an international warranty with global coverage.The bad hinge design continues in its current iteration of the products. Definitely not the quality and support I expected from HP after relatively positive experiences with other HP products(printers, calculators). Not sure if I want to be a customer of their products after this experience.

Reviews.Title: Does not come with 4g Tmobile. Horrible customer support.
Reviews.Author: Christopher P. Olsen "COlsen"
Reviews.Content: The laptop works fine. The "beats" audio is quiet and squeals if you put it too loud, just like any other laptop. This product does NOT come with TMobile 4g. It is a blatant LIE by the company. I contacted their customer support about it and the Indian support personnel who barely spoke English just beat around the bush and said there was " nothing he could do". Blatant, flagrant false advertising. Should be sued.

Reviews.Title: Not so great...
Reviews.Author: nom de plume
Reviews.Content: Received the package promptly, but it was poorly packed and when I opened the outside box, inside was a retail computer box addressed to Staples!!!  It was apparent from the condition of the inside box that it had been shipped unprotected through either the mail, ups or fedex systems.  I was not happy!  If I had wanted this computer from Staples, I would have gone to the store and purchased it there. As it is, I am wondering how the computer was sent from a company that should have no access to Staples' inventory unless it was purchased by someone else and then put on Amazon to sell. Back it goes and I ordered one by ASUS instead!!!

Reviews.Title: Size is the only thing I like
Reviews.Author: Margaret Collison
Reviews.Content: I am very disappointed in this laptop.  It continuously freezes up, is slowwwwww and operates on Windows 8.  I realize it takes time to learn any new operating system, but they took everything good and hid it behind layers of stupid "integrated" pages.  A real waste!I will have Windows 8 removed and see if that improves its operation.

Reviews.Title: Know which dealer you're buying product from.
Reviews.Author: HoopnQ
Reviews.Content: I purchased the product as new it arrived used with dents on the front of system.  one of the processing cards was missing and the trail subscription of office was already expired.  The T-Mobile card was already I installed and didn't work.  I sent it back for an immediate return.  As far as the actual computer... Not impressed.

Reviews.Title: Great computer, Windows 8 has a learning curve
Reviews.Author: Janik
Reviews.Content: Like the style of the laptop, needed a smaller one as I'm going to be traveling much more and needed more than a tablet. Very light and will fit in any of bags with no issue. Its looks like the cover will get marked up, might want to get a skin for it.Screen resolution is great, and bright enough to use in the dark even thought the keyboard isn't back lit. I haven't tried the webcam so I'm not sure how that is. The audio is one of the main reasons I bought this and with my weaker headphones on I listened to some music and it came in great, sometimes on my older comp, I'd have the volume up, but I don't recommend that with these. I like my music loud but this turned all the way up is a big much. It is supposed to have a great fan on the inside but I have been a little worried because I use it in bed and it seems to get a little hot on the bottom. Its not bad and I'm sure if you used it just on your lap it would be fine.Window 8 takes time to get used to, I still down't even have it down and I've been playing around with it each night. There are some apps that can teach you shortcuts, and if you can get to the internet, there are guides out there to help you. If you have Gmail the app looks like it works for that but I don't think it does for yahoo. You can still have a desktop and add a few apps to that, but what I found out is that calculator isn't built in so that is bothersome, having to change between screens rather than just being able to bring it up in a few clicks.Great laptop, but like I said gotta be willing to learn to use windows 8.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY THIS CRAP!
Reviews.Author: Deirdre Simmons "DMS"
Reviews.Content: i've had this computer for about year. JUST TO LET EVERYONE KNOW, about 4 months into having this cheap garbage the hinges became loose and my screen is wobbly and defective. i am also having problems with the screen itself which occasionally flickers lines on it and the so called "beats" audio cant even beat out my I-pod touch speakers! this is a terrible buy i do not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: would be 5 stars if the promised T-Mobile wcould be activated.
Reviews.Author: Frank "Frank"
Reviews.Content: Took full day to upgrade but expected that with HP and Windows 8.  downloaded roughly 60 HP updates and morre MS-8 updates.Everyting but the Broadband is now working satisfactorily and am quite pleased with the set.  As stated, would be 5 stars were it not for the T-mobile issue.  Contacted HP, got customer service [India} and got over one hour of run-arround only to have the last person tell me I had to call T-mobile.  T-mobile stated taht promotional was only for units sold directly from HP or Target.  [nothing about this from HP, they had not a clue what I was asking.]  Not exactly a fan of MS 8 but was able to pick it up fairly quickly and can do what I need to do.  Was not going to pay the extra $$$$$$ to MS for the MS office so loaded new Open Office and it works like a champ!

Reviews.Title: Great computer, shame about the operating system
Reviews.Author: AmericanAbroad "AmericanAbroad"
Reviews.Content: This is the second Pavilion DM1 computer we've bought; the first one was in 2011.  The hardware on this computer is fine, but after starting it for the first time I realized what a terrible mistake I had made buying a Windows 8 computer.  Microsoft got it right with XP and Windows 7, but Windows 8 is just wrong, in so many ways there isn't enough space to go into it here.  It would have been far better for me if this computer had come loaded with Vista.  (I bought and installed the Start8 software which helps return some of Windows 7's functionality, but even that excellent package doesn't overcome all of Windows 8's shortcomings, or defeat all of its frustrating and useless features.)

Reviews.Title: Done with HP
Reviews.Author: rmjaxon
Reviews.Content: After having this computer, I am done with HP for good. The screen, as another poster mentioned, becomes wobbly and does not stay in place. My hard disk drive failed in a year & always made a terrible clicking noise. I bought HP because I knew they used to make good products, but will never buy from them again.

Reviews.Title: I haven't really used it that much!!
Reviews.Author: alo lipio
Reviews.Content: I have had it for less than a month, serves my basic purpose for surfing the internet and e-mailing, but other than that, I haven't really used it for much!! That is all I can really write for now about my notebook...
